greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} lcm(n,k).
link: Akshay Bansal, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from T. D. Noe)
Soichi Ikeda and Kaneaki Matsuoka, On the Lcm-Sum Function, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 17 (2014), Article 14.1.7.
Laszlo Toth, Weighted gcd-sum functions, J. Integer Sequences, 14 (2011), Article 11.7.7
Index entries for sequences related to lcm's
formula: a(n) = n*(1+Sum_{d|n} d*phi(d))/2 = n*(1+A057660(n))/2 = n*A057661(n). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 21 2002
G.f.: x*f'(x), where f(x) = x/(2*(1 - x)) + (1/2)*Sum_{k>=1} k*phi(k)*x^k/(1 - x^k) and phi() is the Euler totient function (A000010). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 31 2017
maple: a:=n->add(ilcm( n, j ), j=1..n): seq(a(n), n=1..50); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 07 2006
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, lcm(n,k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 06 2015
xref: Cf. A000010, A051173 (triangle whose n-th row sum is a(n)).
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
